business.headline: Donald Trump's tariff threat: Top experts discuss what it means for IndiaIn an exclusive panel discussion with Rahul Kanwal, News Director at Aajtak & India Today, leading experts shared their insights on what Trump's tariff threats could mean for India's economy, especially after the recent GDP data.

Post office schemes' interest rates unchanged for January-March 2025. Check hereSmall savings schemes will continue to offer unchanged interest rates for the January-March 2025 period, ensuring investors can enjoy stable returns through the quarter.
Sensex, Nifty surge nearly 2% as auto stocks drive Dalal Street rally The Sensex climbed 1.8% to end at 79,943.71, while the Nifty gained 1.9% to close at 24,188.65.

New pension rules from 2025: Now collect EPS anywhere in IndiaFrom January 1, 2025, EPS pensioners can receive pensions from any bank branch nationwide under the new Centralized Pension Payment System.

Vodafone Idea likely to launch 5G broadband services in March: ReportVodafone Idea plans to introduce 5G with competitively priced plans that could be up to 15% cheaper at entry levels.
ITR filing: Maximise tax savings for FY 2024-25. Check investment optionsTaxpayers can maximise their tax savings for FY 2024-25 by investing in key exemptions before March 31, 2025.

Sensex rallies over 1,000 points: What's behind today's bull run?Stock market rally: The S&P BSE Sensex surged 988.99 points to 79,496.40, while the NSE Nifty50 was up 308.30 points to 308.30 as of 12:50 PM.

Explained: Why Eicher Motors share price rallied 7% todayEicher Motors share price: At 12:31 pm, the stock was trading 6.74% higher at Rs 5,214.85 apiece on the Bombay Stock Exchange, marking a significant jump in its market capitalisation to Rs 1.43 lakh crore.

Air India launches Wi-Fi service on select domestic flights. Check detailsAir India becomes the first airline within the country to offer in-flight Wi-Fi on domestic routes, starting January 1, 2025, with complimentary internet access for passengers.

Maruti Suzuki share price jumps over 4%. What's behind today's gain? Maruti Suzuki stock price: At 12:04 pm, the stock was trading 4.01% higher at Rs 11,671.55 on BSE, with a market capitalisation of Rs 3.67 lakh crore. This marks a significant rally, as the stock has climbed over 6% in the past two days

Missed income tax section 87A rebate? Here's your chance to claim it for FY 2023-24With updates to ITR forms underway, eligible taxpayers can claim Section 87A rebates through revised filings by the extended deadline of January 15, 2025.

Jai Corp share price plummets nearly 20% today. Here's why Jai Corp stock price:  The sharp drop comes after the company disclosed a significant capital reduction proposal involving Urban Infrastructure Holdings Private Limited (UIHPL), in which it holds a 32% equity stake.
Explained: Why Bajaj Finance share price gained 4% in early tradeBajaj Finance stock price: At 11:05 am, it was the top gainer on the Sensex, up 3.74% to Rs 7,195.

Explained: Why RailTel share price gained 7% todayRailTel stock price: Despite today's rise, the stock remains well below its 52-week high of Rs 618, recorded on 12 July 2024. Over the past six months, RailTel's share price has fallen by 11%.
SJVN share price: Stock loses momentum, falls over 2% post 8% jump yesterdaySJVN share price: The stock opened the day at Rs 111.45 after closing at Rs 110.90 in the previous session.

Standard Glass to Capital Infra: 3 IPOs to raise over Rs 2,200 crore next weekTogether, these IPOs aim to raise over Rs 2,200 crore. The listings include Capital Infra Trust, Standard Glass Lining, and Quadrant Future Tek, with Capital Infra Trust being the largest of the three.
Sensex, Nifty open higher; IT and financial stocks boost early momentumThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 153.84 points to 78,661.25, while the NSE Nifty gained 40.10 points to 23,783.00 as of 9:35 AM.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Rohit Sharma set to miss Sydney Test, may never play in whites again: SourcesAustralia vs India, 5th Test: Rohit Sharma may not find a place in the playing XI for the series finale, starting January 3 in Sydney. Pacer Aakash Deep will miss the fifth Test due to injury.

We didn't order to break farmer leader's fast: Why Supreme Court rapped PunjabThe Supreme Court observed that state officials were trying to deliberately create a perception that the bench was persuading Jagjit Singh Dallewal to break the fast.

Three attacks rock US in 24 hours. Coincidence or there's more?The US has been rocked by three attacks in the first couple of days of 2025, leaving 16 dead and dozens injured. With investigators connecting the dots on the New Orleans attack and Tesla blast, people are speculating if these incidents are just coincidence or a part of a larger, coordinated plot.

Bakery owner alleged 'extreme torture' in last video: In-laws wanted Rs 10 lakhA suicide video of Delhi-based bakery owner Puneet Khurana alleging that he was "extremely tortured" by his wife and in-laws and being pressured to give Rs 10 lakh to them has surfaced.
Smelly or loud, why you shouldn't hold your fartsHolding in your farts can lead to discomfort and even pain. Here's why it is better to let it out before things get too steamy!

Iran says it will raise death penalty to Kerala nurse with Yemen: SourcesNimisha Priya, a nurse from Kerala's Palakkad, has been sentenced to death in Yemen for the murder of a Yemeni national. She has been in prison since 2017.

Prashant Kishor goes on hunger strike over Bihar civil services exam rowPoll strategist-turned-politician Prashant Kishor has extended his support to the protesting students and called for "an end to systemic corruption" in Bihar's examinations.

Kerala Congress, CPI(M) leaders spar over Pinarayi's Sanatana Dharma commentA political row erupted between Congress and CPI(M) in Kerala over Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan's comments on Sanatana Dharma. Both parties highlighted differing interpretations, with Congress's VD Satheesan criticising Vijayan's comment, while CPI(M)'s Thomas Isaac defending the Chief Minister.

Blinkit launches 10-minute ambulance service, starting today in Gurugram Each ambulance is equipped with essential life-saving equipment, including oxygen cylinders, Automated External Defibrillators (AEDs), stretchers, monitors, suction machines, and critical emergency medications.

Delhi bakery owner's family claims in-laws went back on Rs 2 crore promiseThe new video shows Puneet Khurana speaking to his father-in-law regarding the transfer of Rs 2 crore for a house. Khurana was found dead at his house in Delhi's Model Town on Tuesday.

Manu Bhaker, D Gukesh and 2 others to receive Khel Ratna AwardDouble Olympic medalist Manu Bhaker and world chess champion D Gukesh are among the four athletes who will receive the Khel Ratna award on January 17. Manu Bhaker's name was initially missing from the list of nominees for the highest sporting award in the country.

Tension in Gujarat after 3 shops on mosque premises 'forcefully' evictedThree shops located on the premises of the Nawab Masjid in Rajkot were rented to three Hindu shopkeepers about 60 years ago. On January 1, a group of people tried to vacate shops, after which a case was filed.

Magnus Carlsen set to marry girlfriend Ella Victoria Malone: ReportsWorld No.1 chess player Magnus Carlsen is set to enter wedlock with 26-year-old Ella Victoria Malone. Carlsen recently shared the World Blitz Championship 2024 title with Russia's Ian Nepomniachtchi.

Centre's blueprint: Mamata Banerjee blames BSF for infiltration from BangladeshMamata Banerjee alleged that the BSF, which guards the Bangladesh border, was allowing infiltration from different areas into Bengal in an attempt to destabilise the state.

Bengaluru techie clarifies after backlash over 'buy MacBook, hire maid' postA Bengaluru techie who went viral earlier this week for his advice to people in their early 20s has clarified his remarks after facing backlash online.

Don't take things for granted: Details of Gambhir's dressing room dressing-down Australia vs India, 5th Test: Head coach Gautam Gambhir had a stern yet constructive talk with the players, including seniors Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma, after the 184-run defeat in the fourth Test in Melbourne. Gambhir addressed chatter about his dressing room speech while talking to the press on Thursday in Sydney.

Farmers slam Diljit Dosanjh-PM meeting: Should have come to protest site insteadDiljit Dosanjh's meeting with PM Modi has drawn criticism from farmers, who feel it contradicts his earlier support for their movement.

Himachal cops kill resort manager for denying food, alcohol; 2 arrestedTwo Himachal Pradesh cops have been arrested for allegedly killing a resort manager and injuring a receptionist during a New Year's celebration.

Bangladesh revises history, textbooks to say Ziaur Rahman declared independenceThe Bangladesh government will revise textbooks to remove exaggerated historical accounts and unnecessary glorification of individuals.

Who is Aashna Shroff, singer Armaan Malik's wife?Singer Armaan Malik recently married Aashna Shroff in a private ceremony. Read on to know everything about the singer's wife, who is an influencer with over 1 million followers on Instagram.

As UP man strangled his family members, father slit their veins: PoliceArshad told the police that while he strangled his family members to death, his father slit their veins using a surgical blade. Arshad said his father sat quietly and watched his sisters suffocate to death.

Omar Abdullah on Centre's J&K statehood promise: Shouldn't take much timeJ&K Chief Minister Omar Abdullah urged the Centre to fulfill its promise of restoring the region's statehood, calling the Union Territory status a temporary phase.

BJP leader blames Congress links to drug mafia for Karnataka maternal deathsKarnataka Leader of Opposition R Ashoka accused the Congress-led state government of being complicit with a "drug mafia" and the cause behind 736 maternal deaths reported in a year. Ashoka alleged substandard drugs are endangering lives and announced a truth-finding committee.

Yash in talks with 20th Century Fox for Toxic's global release: ReportYash is in early discussions with 20th Century Fox for the global release of his upcoming film Toxic. The film is set in the post-Independence era and directed by Geetu Mohandas.

Chahat Pandey's mother on issues with Avinash Mishra: BB 18 makers did not do justiceChahat Pandey's mother slammed Avinash Mishra and others, accusing them of character assassination. She criticised Bigg Boss 18 makers for not addressing the issue.

Identity review: Tovino Thomas, Trisha's thriller is engaging albeit convenientReleased-Thu Jan 02, 2025Identity movie review: Director duo Akhil Paul and Anas Khan's Identity is an action thriller that has more twists in the tale than characters. The film is engaging despite being convenient in many places.

Mika Singh recalls 'horrible' work experience Bipasha Basu, Karan Singh GroverMika Singh shared his disappointment over an unpleasant work experience with actors Bipasha Basu and Karan Singh Grover. The singer highlighted unprofessional behaviour as the main issue during a film project.

Perera's hundred gives SL their first T20I win in New Zealand since 2006Kusal Perera's maiden T20I century helped Sri Lanka register their first T20I win in New Zealand since 2006, a consolation in the three-match T20I series, which the hosts won 2-1.

Cummins set to miss Sri Lanka tour, explains desire to be at home with familyAustralian captain Pat Cummins has hinted that he may skip the upcoming Sri Lanka Test series as he prepares to welcome his second child. Steve Smith or Travis Head may lead Australia if Cummins misses the Sri Lanka tour.

Akash Deep out of Sydney Test with back issue, confirms coach GambhirThe Indian team has suffered a setback ahead of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy decider at the Sydney Cricket Ground (SCG). Pacer Akash Deep has been ruled out of the New Year's Test due to a back injury.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
